circumstances: After takeoff from Palacios Airport, while climbing, both engines lost power. The pilot was cleared to return for an emergency landing and initiated a turn. While flying at low height, the twin engine airplane struck power cables and crashed in a field. All four occupants were slightly injured.
probable_cause:
Partial loss of power on both engines due to inadequate preflight preparation. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Improperly serviced aircraft by ground crew, 
- Improper fuel-grade,
- High obstructions (power cables), 
- Forced landing off airport on land, 
- Aircraft serviced with Jet A fuel.
